Class HardPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • HardPoint

  • public class HardPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a hardpoint on an entity, usually a ship of some sort. A hardpoint is used to link a ship or entity to a component, which gives that ship functionality. Primarily, it updates the position of the component, as the update() method of the component itself is called in the entitys update() method. A hardpoint is a convenient way to pre-position areas on a ship where eventual components can be added, and to know that those components will have their positions updated automatically.
    Author:
    Andrew

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HardPoint(Entity attachedEnt, double percentAcross, double percentUp)
      This constructor is called if you want to create a hardpoint but not attach a component to it.
      HardPoint(Entity attachedEnt, double percentAcross, double percentUp, Component attachedComponent)
      To use this constructor, you must attach a component upon creation of this hardpoint.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Entity getAttachedEnt()
      Returns the entity associated with this hardpoint.
      Component getComponent()
      Returns the component associated with this hardpoint.
      double getLastX()
      Returns the X coordinate of this hardpoint the last update cycle.
      double getLastY()
      Returns the last Y coordinate of this hardpoint the last update cycle.
      double getX()
      Returns the current X coordinate of this hardpoint on this cycle.
      double getY()
      Returns the current Y coordinate of this hardpoint this cycle.
      void installComponent(Component component)
      This method "installs" a component onto this hardpoint.
      void setAttachedEnt(Entity attachedEnt)
      Changes the entity that this hardpoint is attached to.
      void setLastX(double lastX)
      This method sets the X coordinate of the last cycle.
      void setLastY(double lastY)
      This method sets the Y coordinate of the last cycle.
      void setX(double x)
      This method sets the current X coordinate of this hardpoint this cycle.
      void setY(double y)
      This method sets the current Y coordinate of this hardpoint this cycle.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this hardpoint, which contains information including which entity it is attached to, and which component is attached to it.
      void update()
      This method completely updates both the position of this hardpoint and the position of the component attached to this hardpoint, so that the component update() method does not have to worry about updating its position.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HardPoint

        public HardPoint(Entity attachedEnt,
         double percentAcross,
         double percentUp)
        This constructor is called if you want to create a hardpoint but not attach a component to it.
        Parameters:
        attachedEnt - The entity that this hardpoint should be attached to
        percentAcross - The percentage of the attached entitys sprite width, used to define the X coordinate using the entity as a reference frame.
        percentUp - The percentage of the attached entitys sprite height, used to define the Y coordinate using the entity as a reference frame.

      • HardPoint

        public HardPoint(Entity attachedEnt,
         double percentAcross,
         double percentUp,
         Component attachedComponent)
        To use this constructor, you must attach a component upon creation of this hardpoint. Refer to previous constructor remarks for exact implementation
        Parameters:
        attachedEnt - The entity this hardpoint is associated with
        percentAcross - How far across the entity this hardpoint is
        percentUp - How far this hardpoint is in the vertical
        attachedComponent - The component attached to this hardpoint

      • installComponent

        public void installComponent(Component component)
        This method "installs" a component onto this hardpoint. The component will then have its position automatically updated as if it was actually attached to the ship at this hardpoints coordinates.
        Parameters:
        component - The attachedComponent to set

      • setAttachedEnt

        public void setAttachedEnt(Entity attachedEnt)
        Changes the entity that this hardpoint is attached to. The component will remain installed on this hardpoint. This does not change where on the entity the hardpoint is attached. It still retains its percentageAcross and percentageUp values.Not really sure what situation this would be used in, perhaps as a ship salvager?
        Parameters:
        attachedEnt - The entity to which this hardpoint is associated.

      • setLastX

        public void setLastX(double lastX)
        This method sets the X coordinate of the last cycle.
        Parameters:
        lastX - the lastX to set

      • setLastY

        public void setLastY(double lastY)
        This method sets the Y coordinate of the last cycle.
        Parameters:
        lastY - the lastY to set

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)

        Parameters:

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)

        Parameters:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this hardpoint, which contains information including which entity it is attached to, and which component is attached to it.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of this object.

      • update

        public void update()
        This method completely updates both the position of this hardpoint and the position of the component attached to this hardpoint, so that the component update() method does not have to worry about updating its position. Currently does not properly update component positions upon rotation of the associated entity.
